title: Is the mouse problem really a Win10 Creator's Update problem?
body: I'm sure many of you have stumbled upon the problem a fairly decent amount of players are experiencing regarding their side buttons/secondary buttons not working in League. Many of the responses that people are pushing are that's it's a Windows 10 update related problem, but how is that so?  All of the people experiencing this problem, including me, can use our side buttons in every other application/game. The side buttons even work while in the League Client (which I realize when I tried rebinding mouse buttons 4 & 5), but once in game, the League of Legends application doesn't detect these two buttons.

replies.body: The specific issue seems to be that the creator update was forcing the keys to work as OS inputs and not for in-game.  There could also be software being used for the mouse that can serve as the culprit.  If you're having this issue, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team can work with you directly to find the specific cause.  We'll see you there!

Every other game I've played detects them correctly as MB4 and MB5, even LoL client detects it correctly just not the game itself. Had to remap them to keyboard keys but because the LoL directly keeps changing, SteelSeries Engine won't consistently remap for just League so I've had to make that the standard.

Very frustrating.
Exactly! Client recognizes it as well, but when I was in the game and started pressing those buttons nothing happened during the fight, so I died... :D

Yeah I had Flash on MB4 and was mashing it a good three seconds before dying and staring at my mouse like wtf just happened. Remapped to keyboard, once the game was over I remapped it to MB4 in the client like oh yeah this does work wtf only to have the thing in the next game ._.
But support told me that they can't do anything about it...
In some cases the best option was to revert the creator update.  Putting in a ticket gives us an opportunity to review your specific case to see if something else could be going on.
